adjectives.description: conferruminate (comparative more conferruminate, superlative most conferruminate)

entries.meaning: (botany) Closely united by the coalescence of contiguous faces.
examples: The cotyledons of the live-oak acorn are conferruminate.

verbs.description: conferruminate (third-person singular simple present conferruminates, present participle conferruminating, simple past and past participle conferruminated)

entries.meaning: To unite into a solid mass
